page.title: 02Housing
page.content: Housing within our area is very varied. The oldest residence is the Manor, standing next to the church at Wickhamford. This is a large half - timbered Tudor building with many gables. It stands on the site of a grange of Evesham Abbey, overlooking lawns, a lake and a dovecot. Also in the older part of the village are half-timbered, thatched cottages and large farmhouses. Near the Sandys Arms public house are a number of council houses. Along Pitchers Hill is a variety of houses and bungalows. Near the recreation ground is a small estate of more modern housing. At the present time a small estate of new houses is being completed in Wickham Close. The part of Evesham within our area consists almost entirely of newly built houses with small gardens.
